qas.question: The Hawaiian Islands are made up almost entirely of what?
What is the oldest known rock in the world?

answers.text: Acasta gneiss of the Slave craton in northwestern Canada

qas.question: What type of rock is found at the Grand Canyon?
The rocks at the Grand Canyon have been in place since when?
Where is the oldest known rock in the world located?
What is Hawaii made of that has existed since Cambrian time?

plausible_answers.text: have been metamorphosed, faulted, foliated, and folded

qas.question: What has happened to sedimentary, volcanic and intrusive rock in the Grand Canyon?
What has happened to the the rock in the Grand Canyon that is the oldest rock in the world?
What is hard to find about the origin of Grand Canyon rock unless analyzed in a lab?

plausible_answers.text: the Acasta gneiss of the Slave craton

qas.question: What area in northwestern Canada has almost-undeformed stacks of sedimentary rock?
What is the youngest rock to metamorphosize?
How long have the intrusive rocks in the southwestern US been around?
What is the Grand Canyon not an example of?
What is complex about the layering of the Hawaiian islands?

plausible_answers.text: the lower rock units were metamorphosed and deformed

qas.question: What was formed after the undeformed units were deposited?

context: All of these processes do not necessarily occur in a single environment, and do not necessarily occur in a single order. The Hawaiian Islands, for example, consist almost entirely of <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>layered <b13_0>basaltic lava flows<b13_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>. The sedimentary sequences of the mid-continental United States and the Grand Canyon in the southwestern United States contain <b5_0>almost-<b12_0>undeformed stacks of <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>sedimentary<a2_2/><a2_1/> rocks<b12_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/> that have remained in place <b11_0>since <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>Cambrian time<b11_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>. Other areas are much more geologically complex. In the southwestern United States, sedimentary, volcanic, and intrusive rocks <b6_0>have been metamorphosed, faulted, foliated, and folded<b6_0/>. Even older rocks, such as <b9_0>the <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b10_0>Acasta gneiss<b10_0/><a1_1/><a1_0/> of the <a4_0>Slave craton<b9_0/> in <a4_2>northwestern <a4_1>Canada<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/><a1_2/>, the oldest known rock in the world <b7_0>have been metamorphosed<b7_0/> to the point where <b8_0>their origin<b8_0/> is undiscernable without laboratory analysis. In addition, these processes can occur in stages. In many places, the Grand Canyon in the southwestern United States being a very visible example, <b14_0>the lower rock units were metamorphosed and deformed<b14_0/>, and then deformation ended and the upper, undeformed units were deposited. Although any amount of rock emplacement and rock deformation can occur, and they can occur any number of times, these concepts provide a guide to understanding the geological history of an area.
